articles.title: KPA Commanding Officers Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
KPA Commanding Officers Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Commanding officers of the Korean People's Army (KPA) visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday, the Day of Songun, to pay tribute to the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il 
					 Standing on both sides of the statues of the Generalissimos were flags of the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK and colors of the KPA and the guard of honor of the KPA Ground Force, Navy, Air and Anti-Air Force and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards. 
					
					 The chief of the guard of honor paid salute to the statues of the Generalissimos. 
					
					 A floral basket in the name of Marshal Kim Jong Un was placed before their statues.
					
					 Also laid before the statues was a floral basket in the name of the KPA.
					
					 The visitors entered the halls of immortality where the Generalissimos lie in state and paid homage to them. 
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the Generalissimos received are on display and halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Leading officials of the party and state visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday, the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					Among the visitors were senior party and state officials including Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and members of the party central leadership organ in Pyongyang, and officials of the party and power organs, the Cabinet, working organizations, ministries and national institutions.
					
					Seen before the statues of the great leaders was a floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					Also seen standing before them was a floral basket in the name of the KPA.
					
					Laid there was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee of the WPK, Central Military Commission of the WPK, DPRK National Defence Commission, Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					The participants paid high tributes to President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					At the halls where the great leaders lie in state the visitors paid tribute to them.
					
					They went round the room where the orders the great leaders received are on display and halls that house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Ssangunri Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Ssangunri Revolutionary Site
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials visited the Ssangunri Revolutionary Site on Tuesday, the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The visitors included Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior officials of the party and state, chairperson of a friendly party, members of the party central leadership organ in Pyongyang and officials of the party and power bodies, the Cabinet and working people's.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the oil painting of Kim Jong Il finding himself among tankmen and made a bow.
					
					 Being briefed on the monument to field guidance of President Kim Il Sung, they deeply recollected the undying feats he performed by strengthening the Korean revolutionary armed forces. 
					
					 They went round the moment to the poem which was erected in reflection of the unshakable faith of the service personnel and people to glorify the Songun leadership exploits performed by Kim Jong Il, the monument to his field guidance and the room for education in revolutionary history.
					
					 They went round a broad and flat rock on which Kim Jong Il had a meal on that never-to-be-forgotten day, a spring, house of a unit commander, soldiers' quarters, mess hall, education room, food store and others associated with the significant history of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Meet to Renew Their Pledge
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Meet to Renew Their Pledge
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) held a meeting before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces on Tuesday to take a pledge to glorify their youth with heroic feats, holding rifles, under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un. 
					 Present there were officials of the ministry, service personnel of the KPA Ground, Navy and Air and Anti-Air Force and cadets of military academies at all levels. 
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bunches of flowers before the statues of the great leaders and made bows to them.
					
					 Ri Chang Gil, chairman of the KPA Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made a report at the meeting.
					
					 He said that all service personnel and people across the country are significantly greeting the Day of Songun when Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership, and the Youth Day.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership at the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the KPA on Aug. 25, Juche 49 (1960). This was a significant event that heralded before the whole world the birth of the new era for the succession to the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche which was pioneered by the President and the birth of the historic era when the young vanguard under arms are making a breakthrough for the revolution and construction, the idea of attaching importance to arms and that of considering the youth as important being regarded as just the same.
					
					 The Songun revolutionary cause of Juche is being steadily carried forward to a final victory by the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The reporter called on all service personnel to carry on dynamic struggle to successfully accomplish the Songun revolutionary cause of Juche as becoming revolutionaries who lead a worthwhile life under the care of the great leaders and the great party. 
					
					 Then the floor was taken by officers and non-commissioned officers. 
					
					 They vowed to wipe out  the group of aggressors with the arms of Paektusan which Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il provided as  powerful treasured sword  of Songun all their lives and fly the red flag of the final victory of Songun revolution.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked in DPRK
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked in DPRK
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Events were held with splendor in the DPRK to mark the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 An endless stream of people visited the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun, the sacred temple of Juche, where President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state.
					
					 They paid tribute to the portraits of the smiling great leaders after entering the park.
					
					 They spent meaningful time at the plaza park successfully built as a grand flower garden for immortality of the great leaders.
					
					 Service personnel, peoples of various social strata and school youth and children visited the statues of the great leaders and portraits of the smiling great leaders on Mansu Hill and in various places.
					
					 Art performances were given in various parts of the country.
					
					 Colorful acrobatic numbers were staged at the Pyongyang Circus Theater.
					
					 Diverse sports and cultural events took place at organs, enterprises, factories, cooperative farms and construction sites including the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill and the construction site of the stockbreeding base in Sepho area.
					
					 Dancing parties of youths and students took place in various parts of the country.

articles.title: Pakistani President Supports DPRK
articles.content:
Pakistani President Supports DPRK
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK ambassador Kim Thae Sop presented his credentials to Mamnoon Hussain, president of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, on August 21.
					 The president said that President Kim Il Sung and leaders of Pakistan provided the foundation of the friendly relations between the two countries. 
					
					 He hoped the relations would grow stronger and develop constantly in the future, too, under the deep care of Marshal Kim Jong Un and also wished the Korean people success in the struggle to achieve wealth and prosperity of the country under his wise leadership.
					
					 Pakistan fully supports the struggle of the Korean people for achieving the reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation free from foreign interference, he added.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK's leading newspapers Tuesday dedicate editorials to the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Rodong Sinmun says that the Day of Songun is the one of history that guarantees the steady succession to the Songun revolutionary cause started in Mt. Paektu and eternal victory of the Workers' Party of Korea and revolution. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Thanks to this day all gains of the revolution achieved by many well-known and unsung anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners at the cost of their sweat and blood have been firmly defended and our country's prestige, dignity and national power put on the highest level in history.
					
					 Kim Jong Il had covered the road of the Songun leadership for over a half century from the very day he visited a tank division. The road was like the one of bloody battles as it claimed an indescribably high price and the one of faith to be followed only with hope and the one of total dedication along which he had to steer the revolution day and night, risking his life.
					
					 He was so great that he made endless arduous long journeys for Songun leadership to the last moments of his life, with ardent love for the socialist country, its people and younger generation. This was something which no other statesmen could ever venture.
					
					 Thanks to the high-intensity forced march made by the iron-willed Songun brilliant commander, our country could build the most powerful muscle  in the nation's history spanning 5 000 years and the Juche revolution could demonstrate its dignity before the world as a cause making a long drive despite all tests of history.
					
					 The world history records a lot of famous statesmen and great men who performed feats in carving out the destiny of popular masses and in the world history of politics, but it knows no such outstanding leader, peerless patriot and great revolutionary as Kim Jong Il who made great contributions to the country and nation, era and mankind.
					
					 Minju Joson says that his sacred history of Songun revolutionary leadership is being carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un, calling upon all the service personnel and people to carry on the dynamic struggle to build a thriving nation and bring earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, remaining  true to his Songun revolutionary leadership.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, bereaved family member of DPRK Hero An Tong Su, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday, the 55th Day of Songun.
					 She laid a floral basket before their statues and paid tribute to them.
					
					 On the day, a delegation for marking the 70th anniversary of the formation of the Union of Korean Students in Japan visited the statues.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons, people of various strata, school youth and children visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 Seen standing before the statues was a floral basket sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Laid before the statues were floral baskets in the names of the party, armed forces and power organs, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, institutions, enterprises, factories and schools her.
					
					 The visitors paid tribute to the great leaders before their statues, recollecting their undying feats.
					
					 An endless stream of visitors flowed to the statues and portraits of the smiling great leaders in various places of the city including Kim Il Sung University, Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, Ministry of People's Security and the Mansudae Art Studio.
					
					 Service personnel, working people, school youth and children across the country visited the statues and portraits of the smiling great leaders in their residential areas.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- The participants in the International Symposium-2015 of Kim Il Sung University on Tuesday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the university. 
					 They placed floral baskets and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: 5th Rason International Trade Exhibition Held
articles.content:
5th Rason International Trade Exhibition Held
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- The 5th Rason International Trade Exhibition was held in the DPRK.
					 The exhibition drew at least 90 units from the DPRK, Russia, Italy, Dominica, Germany and other countries.
					
					 Yury Viktorovich Bochkarev, consul general of the Russian Federation in Chongjin, the DPRK, said that eight Russian companies took part in the exhibition sponsored on a high level.
					
					 It is expected that more Russian businessmen will participate in the exhibition next year, too, to have contracts or cooperation with the DPRK, he added.
					
					 Felix Glenk, senior researcher of the delegation of the Hanns Seidel Foundation, said that his delegation sought business opportunities for the development of the Rason economic and trade zone in the fields of environment and economic cooperation.
					
					 Michael Spavor, a staff of the Paektu Culture Exchange in Britain, expressed the will to redouble efforts for the DPRK.

articles.title: International Symposium-2015 Opens at Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
International Symposium-2015 Opens at Kim Il Sung University
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- The International Symposium-2015 of Kim Il Sung University opened with due ceremony on August 25. 
					 The symposium on the theme of "Scientific development and building of highly civilized nation" will hear dozens of valuable scientific papers. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, teachers and researchers of the university, delegations of the People's University and the Yanbian University in China, delegates from Nanjing University and Beijing University in China, the Center for Massive Data Algorithmic in Denmark, New York University, Free University of Brussels and University of Leicester in Britain.
					
					 Ri Kuk Chol, vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, made an opening address to be followed by congratulatory speeches.

articles.title: Dancing Parties Held on Day of Songun
articles.content:
Dancing Parties Held on Day of Songun
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Dancing parties of youths and students took place in different parts of the country on Tuesday, the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The venues of dancing parties in Pyongyang including the plazas of the Arch of Triumph and the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium were crowded with youths and students celebrating the auspicious day. 
					
					 When the song "Fortune of Korea" was played in reflection of profound reverence for Kim Jong Il, youths and students presented dances, looking back on his immortal revolutionary exploits. 
					
					 They cheerfully danced to the tunes of songs "Whistling Boy," "Ballad of Roast Chestnut," "Girlhood," etc. Optimism and enthusiasm could be read on the faces of members of the youth vanguard carving out rosy future of the country thanks to the Songun politics enforced by the peerlessly great men. 
					
					 The festive mood was revved up when the songs "Youth and Courage," "We Will Devote Our Youth to Motherland" and "Dash ahead toward Future" were played.
					
					 Similar dancing parties took place in provincial seats on the same day.

articles.title: Songun Policy Ensures Peace in Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Songun Policy Ensures Peace in Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Fifty-five years has passed since the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il began his Songun leadership in the DPRK.
					 Thanks to his Songun (army-first) policy, the Korean People's Army further developed into invincible armed forces and defeated every war provocation from the U.S. imperialists, displaying the might of the DPRK.
					
					 In Juche 92 (2003) when RC-135, a U.S. military reconnaissance plane, intruded into the DPRK's territorial sky, the KPA foiled the reckless provocative move by immediately setting its fighter plane into motion.
					
					 Terming this second EC-121 case, the U.S. could not but ban the flight of RC-135 for a while, frightened at strong counteraction from the KPA.
					
					 At that time, world media reported that the case showed the KPA does never make empty talk and the DPRK guided by the Songun policy is quite different from Iraq.
					
					 On the military might of the DPRK and its strong will, media of Western European countries stressed that the DPRK is the only military power who is ready to fight an overall war with the U.S.
					
					 The Songun policy continues under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un in the DPRK.

articles.title: Seminar Held in Japan
articles.content:
Seminar Held in Japan
Tokyo, August 24 (KNS-KCNA) -- The Tokyo international seminar-70 years after war took place in Japan on August 22 on the issue of Japan's liquidation of the past and peace in East Asia.
					 Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Son Hyong Gun, chairman of the Japanese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, Ri Chang Bok, permanent representative of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, Shingo Fukuyama, representative of the Peace Forum, Japanese figures and peace activists of Japan, south Korea and overseas.
					
					 Nam Sung U underscored the need to warn the U.S. and south Korean authorities of their policy of escalating the confrontation with the DPRK while increasing the danger of war and Japan of pursuing its hostile policy toward the DPRK while stepping up militarization without making apology and reparation for its past crimes. He called for building up fair public opinion conducive to achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula and in East Asia.
					
					 Ramsey Clark, former attorney general of the U.S., in a video letter said the Korean people suffered war disaster imposed by the U.S., and big powers are now posing military threats to the Korean Peninsula and East Asia.
					
					 A declaration was adopted at the seminar.
					
					 It called for working hard to pressurize the Japanese government to admit the legal blame for aggression and colonial domination and make an apology and reparation for them and to achieve peaceful reunification on the basis of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Minju Joson Brands U.S. as World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
Minju Joson Brands U.S. as World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. internet magazine Box posted an article disclosing the horrible genocide committed by the U.S. against the Korean people during the Korean War.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday cites facts to prove that the world community was shocked by the crimes committed by the U.S. during the Korean War including the massacre of innocent residents, horrible germ warfare and vandalism and plunder of cultural treasures.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressors revealed themselves that they were a pack of beasts in human skin before the world throughout the war, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is going reckless to ignite the second Korean War.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the U.S. is engrossed in all sorts of human rights abuses not only on the Korean Peninsula but also in other parts of the world.
					
					 The U.S. is, indeed, the world's worst human rights abuser as it has committed crimes against humanity across the world since it made its appearance in the world. This is the common view of the world community.
					
					 Such empire of evil is working hard to judge other countries while behaving as if it were "a human rights judge" in the eyes of the world. This is a mockery of justice and conscience and insult to the noble human rights.
					
					 The world peace-loving people who value human rights should deal a sledge-hammer blow at the U.S. in a court of history.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Media for Cooking up Fabrications
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Media for Cooking up Fabrications
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary lashes out at conservative media in south Korea for going busy with false propaganda against the DPRK by use of misinformation. 
					 Channel A and MBC recently spread groundless lies to tarnish the dignified social system of the DPRK and incite north-south confrontation. 
					
					 After receiving a petty amount of money those despicable human scum of Channel A and MBC told rubbish about "a decree" in a bid to bitterly hurt the intense loyalty of the people in the DPRK. They even took issue with the rule of becoming health seekers of the Pyongyang Home for the Aged, uttering this or that. 
					
					 What is enraging everybody is that the south Korean puppet forces keen on money making dared take issue with the amazing reality of the DPRK, the commentary says, and goes on: 
					
					 Their disgusting remarks are the major cause bedeviling the north-south relations and increasing danger of war. 
					
					 We have already warned the south Korean authorities of driving the north-south relations to the worst phase through anti-DPRK smear campaign and quasi media blindly following them. 
					
					 Journalists and anchor persons of Channel A and MBC agitating confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and war had better stop recklessly wagging their tongues, properly understanding the strong will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to take revenge upon them.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed by Syrian Media
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed by Syrian Media
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Syrian media dedicated special write-ups to the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The Aug. 12th issue of the newspaper Al Baath carried an article titled "Korea's liberation, a turning point in history" illustrated with a photo showing the might of the heroic Korean People's Army.
					
					 It praised President Kim Il Sung for liberating the country and building the party, saying that the country's liberation for the Korean people meant not only the national restoration but also a historic event which brought about a decisive turn in their destinies, i.e. from slaves to masters.
					
					 It referred to the fact that the overall democratic reforms were successfully carried out in the DPRK in a short span of time after the liberation and on their basis the first democratic people's state was founded in the East and the DPRK could advance guided by its original idea since its early years.
					
					 The Aug. 14th issue of the newspaper Al Thawrah in an article indicated the significance of its liberation and introduced the proud path covered by the DPRK.
					
					 The Aug. 15th issue of the paper Tishrin carried an article titled "The DPRK greets the 70th anniversary of the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, it ushers in a great avenue of independent reunification".
					
					 The Syrian Arab News Agency and central TV carried images dealing with the revolutionary activities of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and introduced their exploits.
					
					 The central radio broadcasting made a special report on the same day.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting in Pakistan and lectures in Guinea and Uganda on August 12 and 15 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The chairman of the Lahore Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Pakistan in his report paid high respect to President Kim Il Sung and praised him for accomplishing the historic cause of the country's liberation by leading the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory.
					
					 Speakers said that the exploits performed by the President for the cause of national liberation and by leader Kim Jong Il who laid a solid foundation of building a thriving socialist nation with the Songun politics will be remembered generation after generation.
					
					 The chairman of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement, chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, chairman of the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Makerere University and other speakers praised the President for bringing the dawn of national restoration and building the first people's democratic state in the East by leading the anti-Japanese war to victory.
					
					 The commander of the First Commando Force of the Almami Samori Toure Barracks of the Guinean Army said that the exploits of the President who liberated Korea through the Songun leadership will be recorded in the history of the world anti-imperialist national liberation struggle.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Praised by Personages of France, Syria
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Praised by Personages of France, Syria
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Personages of France and Syria issued statements on August 11 and 12 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Guy Dupre, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said:
					
					 The Korean people waged vigorous struggle to end the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and liberate the country under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and finally regained the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 The President and leader Kim Jong Il laid out national reunification proposals of historic significance and developed socialist Korea into a country independent, self-sufficient and self-reliant in defence, wisely leading the Korean people's movement for national reunification.
					
					 Saber Ballul, head of a department of the Political Faculty of the University of Damascus of Syria, said:
					
					 The President is an outstanding ideological theoretician who performed immortal ideological and theoretical exploits by creating the original Juche idea and Songun idea.
					
					 Kim Jong Il who carried forward the cause of the President firmly defended socialism chosen by the Korean people bravely smashing the imperialists' persistent moves to stifle the DPRK under the banner of the Juche idea and Songun idea. 
					
					 On the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, the progressive people of the world sincerely wished the friendly Korean people lasting victory and prosperity in their struggle for the building of a thriving nation and for national reunification under the leadership of H.E. Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Indonesian Paper Raps U.S. Moves to Stifle DPRK
articles.content:
Indonesian Paper Raps U.S. Moves to Stifle DPRK
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- An Indonesian internet paper carried an article titled "70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, U.S. hostile policy towards DPRK" on August 10.
					 After the end of WWII the U.S. designated the DPRK as the main target it has to stifle in the Asia-Pacific region, the article, said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK has deep roots.
					
					 It enforced the hostile policy towards the DPRK long before the nuclear issue spawned on the Korean peninsula. They neither established diplomatic relations with the DPRK nor called the official name of the country properly.
					
					 After the Korean War the U.S. reduced south Korea to its military base for aggression and has resorted to all possible means to stand in the way of the improvement of the inter-Korean relations. The U.S. is making desperate efforts to realize their domination over the whole Korean peninsula.
					
					 It also framed numerous scenarios to stifle the DPRK which are in the course of implementation.
					
					 The historical truth clearly proves that the hostile policy towards the DPRK was not caused by the possession of nuclear weapons by the DPRK but Pyongyang was forced to have access to the nuclear weapons due to the Washington's hostile policy.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The Malaysian paper Guang Ming Daily on August 6 carried an article illustrated with the portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The article said that the President was a legendary commander, who started the armed struggle with two pistols he had received from his father and finally liberated the country on August 15, 1945.
					
					 The Lao paper Vatelao on Aug. 12 carried an article titled "Korea's liberation, a turning point in history" illustrated with the portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The article said that the liberation didn't merely mean national restoration but was a historic event that brought about a change in the fate of the Korean people, making them master from slave.
					
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event on Aug. 12 dedicated two whole pages to articles titled "Legendary guerrilla" illustrated with photos of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Korea-succession of socialist cause" said that the President pioneered the socialist cause of Korea.

articles.title: Inaugurado simposio internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung-2015
articles.content:
Inaugurado simposio internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung-2015
Pyongyang, 25 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado el Simposio Academico Internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung-2015.
					En el presente seminario con el tema "El Desarrollo de ciencia y la construccion de pais civilizado", se presentaran decenas de tesis de valor.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 25 en la Universidad Kim Il Sung la ceremonia inaugural del simposio.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Thae Hyong Chol, rector del dicho plantel docente y ministro de Educacion Superior, los profesores e investigadores de la universidad, las  delegaciones de la Universidad del Pueblo, la Universidad de Yanbian, la Universidad de Nanjing, la Universidad de Beijing, de China, los representantes del Centro de Enorme Data Algoritmica de Dinamarca, la Universidad de Nueva York de Estados Unidos, la Universidad Libre de Bruselas de Belgica y la Universidad de Leicester en Gran Bretana.
					
					El discurso inaugural estuvo a cargo de Ri Kuk Chol, vicerrector de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					
					A continuacion, hubo discursos de felicitacion.

articles.title: Minju Joson aboga por llevar EE.UU. a banquillo de acusados de historia
articles.content:
Minju Joson aboga por llevar EE.UU. a banquillo de acusados de historia
Pyongyang, 25 de agosto (ACNC) -- Recientemente, la revista online Box de EE.UU. inserto un articulo intitulado "Los norteamericanos olvidaron que hicieron en el Norte de Corea" revelando los actos de violacion de los derechos humanos cometidos por los yanquis contra el pueblo coreano en el periodo de la pasada guerra coreana.
					En un comentario individual del dia 25 el periodico Minju Joson revela con los datos los crimenes de EE.UU. que asesino masivamente a los habitantes inocentes y cometio las atrocidades de guerra bacteriologica, la destruccion y el  saqueo de bienes culturales y continua:
					
					Durante la guerra coreana, los agresores norteamericanos pusieron al desnudo que ellos mismos son la banda de las bestias con la mascara humana.
					
					Hoy en dia, los imperialistas yanquis actuan sin juicio para desatar la segunda guerra coreana.
					
					Lo que no podemos pasar por alto es que EE.UU. perpetra los crimenes de violacion de derechos humanos de toda indole  tanto en el Sur de Corea como en todas partes del mundo.
					
					La sociedad internacional tiene el criterio comun de que desde su aparicion en este planeta hasta la fecha EE.UU. no deja de recurrir a los crimenes antieticos en la esfera mundial.
					
					El imperio de los males al proceder como "juez de DDHH" en el mundo trata de sentenciar arbitrariamente a otros paises, lo cual deviene la burla a la justicia y la conciencia y el insulto a los sagrados derechos humanos.
					
					Los pueblos amantes de la paz mundial que aprecian los DDHH deben llevar EE.UU., peor pais criminal de los derechos humanos, al banquillo de los acusados de la historia para darle el severo castigo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia demagogia anti- RPDC de medios de prensa surcoreanos
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia demagogia anti- RPDC de medios de prensa surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 25 de agosto (ACNC) -- En un comentario individual divulgado el dia 25, Rodong Sinmun revela el hecho de que los medios de prensa conservadores del Sur de Corea se entregan a la demagogia anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea a base de datos inventados.
					Hace poco, Channel A y MBC transmitieron absurdos hechos para manchar el digno regimen de la RPDC e inculcar la confrontacion Norte-Sur, recuerda el comentario y continua:
					
					Las escorias humanas de estos venales medios soltaron unas tonterias difamantes a la noble fidelidad de los habitantes de la RPDC cuestionando un llamado "decreto" de esta y las normas de ingreso al asilo de ancianos de Pyongyang.
					
					Causan nuestra indignacion los disparates de los titeres traidores surcoreanos que tergiversan la realidad reluciente de la RPDC para ganar algun dinero.
					
					La ofensiva verbal de los medios de prensa titeres contra la RPDC deviene el principal motivo del empeoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas y el aumento del peligro de la guerra.
					
					Ya advertimos a la banda titere que recurriendo a la intriga anti-RPDC, lleva las relaciones intercoreanas a la peor situacion y a los medios de prensa que actuan a ciegas.
					
					Los periodistas y las locutoras de Channel A y MBC deben mantener callados tras ver correctamente la voluntad de venganza del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC.
